intro: Palicourea subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
